intro: Elytraria filicaulis, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a small evergreen plant belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its compact, moss-like appearance with dense clusters of tiny, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, which are typically small and clustered near the base of the plant. Elytraria filicaulis thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate regions with cool, humid climates. Its slow growth and unique morphology make it a distinctive species within the clubmoss family.
